org.mindswap.owls.process.execution
Interface ProcessExecutionEngine

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.EventListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
ProcessExecutionEngineImpl
public interface ProcessExecutionEngine
extends java.util.EventListener

Process execution engines implement the functionality required to execute atomic as well as composite processes.

Method Detail

addMonitor

boolean addMonitor(ProcessExecutionMonitor monitor)
Add the given monitor. This method may even be invoked while this engine is executing some process, i.e., the new monitor will included immediately to receive event notifications.

Parameters:
monitor - The monitor to add.
Returns:
true if the monitor was added.

removeMonitor

boolean removeMonitor(ProcessExecutionMonitor monitor)
Remove the given monitor (provided that is was added before). This method may even be invoked while this engine is executing some process, i.e., the monitor will receive no event afterwards.

Parameters:
monitor - The monitor to remove.
Returns:
true if the monitor was removed.

getExecutionValidator

ExecutionValidator getExecutionValidator()
Returns:
The execution validator that is currently used for precondition and result evaluation.

setExecutionValidator

ExecutionValidator setExecutionValidator(ExecutionValidator ev)
Parameters:
ev - The execution validator to be used for precondition and result evaluation.
Returns:
The validator that was set before (if any).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If invoked while this engine is currently executing some process.

execute

ValueMap<Output,OWLValue> execute(Process p,
                                  OWLKnowledgeBase kb)
                                  throws ExecutionException
Execute the given process with no input value bindings. Consequently, the process must not have any input parameters, or, in case of a composite, all its input value bindings must refer to constant data (see ValueConstant).

Parameters:
p - Process to execute.
kb - The KB where preconditions and (intermediate) results will be evaluated. In other words, this is simply the execution environment. If null, the KB of the process being executed is used instead.
Returns:
Value bindings for the output parameters upon execution.
Throws:
ExecutionException - execution failed, i.e., ended prematurely.

execute

ValueMap<Output,OWLValue> execute(Process p,
                                  ValueMap<Input,OWLValue> inputs,
                                  OWLKnowledgeBase kb)
                                  throws ExecutionException
Execute the given OWL-S process with the given input value bindings. The inputs map must bind all input parameters of the process to some value.

Parameters:
p - Process to execute.
inputs - Value bindings for the input parameters.
kb - The KB where preconditions and (intermediate) results will be evaluated. In other words, this is simply the execution environment. If null, the KB of the process being executed is used instead.
Returns:
Value bindings for the output parameters upon execution.
Throws:
ExecutionException - execution failed, i.e., ended prematurely.

execute

ValueMap<Output,OWLValue> execute(Perform p,
                                  OWLKnowledgeBase kb)
                                  throws ExecutionException
Execute the given perform construct. Perform should contain all the required input bindings specified.

Parameters:
p - The perform to execute.
kb - The KB where preconditions and (intermediate) results will be evaluated. In other words, this is simply the execution environment. If null, the KB of the perform being executed is used instead.
Returns:
Value bindings for the output parameters upon execution.
Throws:
ExecutionException - execution failed, i.e., ended prematurely.

setCaching

boolean setCaching(boolean caching)
Toggle the caching policy. Implementations of this interface may use (arbitrary) caching strategies in order to boost execution performance. Since caching may not be permitted in any situation it can be set accordingly using this method.

For instance, the default implementation provided by the library (c.f. OWLSFactory.createExecutionEngine()) can cache control constructs of a composite process in order to boost performance if control constructs of the composite process are executed repeatedly. In order not to cause inconsistencies between the backing data model and the cache, it is required that the backing triples that make up the composite process do not change during execution, i.e., the process must not change. Thus, in case applications require such dynamic changes of the process while it is executed one must not activate caching in this case (when using the default execution engine).

Parameters:
caching - true to enable caching, false to disable caching.
Returns:
The previous value.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If toggling caching policy is currently forbidden, for instance, because the engine is currently executing a process.
